Welcome to the Yale School of Public Health Data Science and Data Equity (YSPH DSDE) Data Concierge—your gateway to accessible data science and AI resources in public health. This comprehensive collection was assembled to support DSDE’s mission of reducing barriers to data science and AI adoption in public health training, research, and practice.

Our mission is to build robust public health data science infrastructure that ensures secure, equitable data access and transforms complex methodologies into user-friendly, open-source tools and publicly available datasets. We're committed to making high-quality public health resources accessible to all and fostering data-driven decision-making in public health.

## Navigating the Site

Navigate our comprehensive collection of curated resources and datasets using the tile below. Sourced from international organizations, U.S. agencies, and Yale University, each resource includes detailed access information, timelines, and examples of published Yale-affiliated research to support your public health studies.

Each tile contains salient details about the offering, as shown in the example below. The lower section of each tile includes hyperlinked icons and a brief keyword describing the subject area.

Each tile features any combination of five hyperlinked icons:

<i class="bi bi-globe" style="color: var(--link-color);"></i> \ Links to the main website for the dataset/resource.

<i class="bi bi-people-fill" style="color: var(--link-color);"></i> \ Links to websites of research groups offering the dataset/resource.

<i class="bi bi-github" style="color: var(--link-color);"></i> \  Links to code repositories associated with the dataset/resource.

<i class="bi bi-journal-text" style="color: var(--link-color);"></i> \ Links to sample publications that showcase the dataset/resource provided by the creators.

<i class="bi bi-info-circle" style="color: var(--link-color);"></i> \ Links to our **Resource Navigation Tool** with comprehensive details about the dataset.
